Options (simplified as requested):

Definitely

Maybe

No

How the algorithm interprets these:
Answer	Meaning	Impact
Definitely	Strong positive preference	Pushes the course upward
Maybe	Neutral / undecided	Keeps it centered
No	Strong negative preference	Pushes course downward

This initial choice strongly influences what comparison cards are surfaced next.

✅ 3. Step Two — Beli-Style Comparison Cards

After the first answer, FAIRWAY shows a direct comparison:

Prompt:

“Which course do you like more?”

Left card → Pine Ridge
Right card → One of the user’s past courses

Card Includes:

Course name

Small photo

Location

Past score (in small text)

Play count

User Action:

Tap the course they prefer.

Algorithm’s Selection of Comparison Courses

The app chooses comparison opponents in this order:

Tier-Match: A course with similar user rating

Top Favorite: A course the user scored highly

Low Favorite: A course the user disliked

Boundary Tester: A random course to test preference edges

Each comparison gives the system a “win” or “loss” for Pine Ridge.

✅ 4. Step Three — Drag-to-Rank Placement (Signature Beli Mechanic)

The most defining part of FAIRWAY’s rating system.

Prompt:

“Where does Pine Ridge belong in your list?”

UI Behavior:

The screen shows your personal course ranking list

Each course appears as a stack of vertical cards

Pine Ridge card floats and is draggable

User places it above/below others based on preference

Sorting Logic:

The user’s placement creates an exact “preference position” in their personal list.

Example result:

Whistling Straits

Sand Valley

Pine Ridge

Hawks Landing

Local Muni

This is the core ranking that powers the final score.

✅ 5. Step Four — Auto-Generated 1–10 Score

FAIRWAY generates a numeric score automatically using the data from the previous steps:

Inputs used:

Play Again Response (Definitely / Maybe / No)

Comparison Wins/Losses

Final Drag-to-Rank Position

Relative difficulty of ranked neighbors

Consistency with user’s historic preferences

How the score is determined:

The system finds Pine Ridge’s position between neighboring courses.

Example:

Sand Valley = 8.8

Hawks Landing = 7.5

Pine Ridge was placed between them → Score becomes ~8.1

If placed:

Near bottom → Score ~3–4

In middle → Score ~6–7

Near top → Score ~8–9+

Key Note:

Users never see any numbers during the rating flow, keeping it subjective and personal — just like Beli.

✅ 6. Final Confirmation Screen

After the score is computed, the app shows:

“Pine Ridge added to your Fairway List.”

Display includes:

The final 1–10 score

Where it ranks on the user's list

How it compares to friend ratings

How many times the user has played it
